story_prompt: You died and awoke in the afterlife. It's quite nice actually. The people and atmosphere are a lot nicer than you are used to and there is no stress or pressure. When you ask what good deed got you into heaven you are informed that this is hell, followed by a visit from a very concerned demon.
characters:
Characters:

1. The protagonist (You)
2. The demon who informs them they are in Hell.
3. The angel who shows them around Heaven.

--

I died and awoke in the afterlife. It was quite nice, actually. The people and atmosphere were a lot nicer than I was used to, and there was no stress or pressure. I was feeling rather pleased with myself, enjoying the peace and tranquility, when a demon appeared before me. He looked concerned, which concerned me.

"Uh, hello there," I said, trying to sound friendly. "I don't mean to be rude, but why are you here? And why do you look so worried?"

The demon sighed. "I'm afraid I have some bad news for you. You see, this isn't actually heaven. It's hell."

I stared at him in shock. "What?! But...but this is so nice here! How could this be hell?"

The demon shook his head. "I know it's hard to believe, but trust me, it's true. And I'm afraid you're stuck here forever."

I felt my heart sink. Forever?! In hell?! How could this be?!

Just then, an angel appeared. She was dressed in white and had a kind smile. "Hello there. I see you've met our friend the demon. Let me show you around and help you get settled."

I was still in shock, but I tried to play along. "Settled?! But this is hell! Why would I want to settle here?"

The angel chuckled. "Oh, it's not so bad. We have all sorts of interesting people here. And think of it this way: you'll never have to pay taxes again!"

I couldn't help but laugh at that. "I suppose that's a silver lining."

As the angel showed me around, I couldn't help but notice the contrast between her and the demon. She was so cheerful and kind, while he seemed so...concerned. I wondered what their stories were, and how they ended up here.

"So, uh, what's your name?" I asked the angel.

"I'm Angelica," she replied. "And this is my domain. I'm responsible for making sure everyone feels welcome and comfortable."

I nodded. "Well, you're certainly doing a great job. This place is amazing."

The demon cleared his throat. "If you'll excuse me, I need to get back to work. It was nice meeting you..."

"...Ian," I said, extending my hand.

He shook it. "Ian. Yes, it was nice meeting you too. I'll see you around, I'm sure."

As he disappeared, Angelica turned to me with a mischievous grin. "Shall we explore some more? I have a feeling you're going to love it here."

I couldn't help but smile back. "Absolutely. Lead the way, Angelica."

As we walked, I couldn't help but wonder what other surprises this strange new world had in store for me. But for now, I was content to enjoy the peace and tranquility, and try to make the best of my eternal stay in hell.
